These do neither of those things.  Super comfortable.  Have not had the product long enough to speak to quality over time.

reviews: In some colourways the amazon images show a sizing chart. ignore that entirely as it is wrong and just get what size you would normally wear. The shaping isn't perfect for me but it's fine and the price is ok. They're comfortable all day, for hours of walking etc. and prevent chafing.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym

reviews: These seemed fine when only doing small runs or light exercise. As you increase the distance, chafing becomes really bad due to the seam being thick and right in the worst place. They have become useless for longer runs due to the pain they cause.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: I'm not sure what everyone was on about with the size being correct, but I have a 31 inch waist which would make me an XL in their sizing guide. I wanted them to be tight fitting so I ordered L thinking it should work, but they are wayyyyy too big. I should have just gone with my normal sizing instead of following their guide. So now I'm stuck with them since they came from Amazon US to Amazon AU, paying an extra $20 for quick shipping, and for me to return them it will cost me another $24 in shipping! So basically I've spent twice the amount of the actual item, and they are unusable. Don't waste your money!

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: sports - excerise

reviews: For the price, this 3 pack is awesome! Good fit, comfortable and they don't get too sweaty during training. In terms of "compression", they are not that tight and I don't think they have that much of an impact on circulation or muscle support but they do hold everything in place! As a base layer, they are a great cheap piece of training clothing 👍

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: I have had these for a few runs now and have to say I'm very impressed. The fabric feels great and the fit is fantastic. The pockets along the thighs are perfect for your phone if you like to listen to music while you excercise. They even held a full set of car and housekeys and I promise I didn't even notice they were there when I ran. Everything stays snug without being at all restrictive. If you are thinking of wearing just these while you run (I prefer shorts over them), they do have a pretty visible VPL for men. Don't care about that here and I will be ordering again.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Bought these to help with chafing whilst at work, and I’ve not been disappointed!! They work really well and are really comfortable it took me 2/3 times to get used to how much heat they keep in so I was really hot at work but I’m used to it now and find them so comfortable.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Bout these for myself for use under my work trousers, I liked them so much I got my partner to get me another set. They are comfortable and fit perfectly. The pockets are a good size also.

I like the pockets on the side, you can fit your phone in easily and it won't fall out. They are soft and feel like they're made of nice material.

reviews: Die Shorts sind sehr angenehm zu tragen und Handy, Kopfhörer, Schlüssel, etc. bleiben auch in den Taschen, wenn man sich sportlich betätigt. Für den Preis wirklich super.Natürlich sind die Shorts eng - das sollen sie ja auch sein, denn es sind eben Kompressionsshorts.Der Support vom Verkäufer ist ebenfalls sehr gut.Bei der Lieferung gab zunächst einen Fehler - habe daraufhin den Verkäufer kontaktiert und dieser hat sich sehr kundenfreundlich verhalten.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Buena calidad y comodos.Se adapta al cuerpo y los bolsillos genial.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: I am 5’5”, 162lbs, and normally wear at 31 waist in jeans. Medium size worked well.I’ve run 5km, walked a couple more, I did my typical weight training routine, and shot around with a basketball. The pockets of these compression shorts worked great under my regular shorts. My phone stayed compressed against my leg and didn’t bounce around. I probably wouldn’t play a full out basketball game, but running around a track worked perfect.I use my iPhone SE when I work out but my work iPhone 14 fits well in the pocket. See attached photos.The material worked well, wicking away sweat and keeping the area cool and comfortable. No chaffing experienced.I plan on buying another pack later.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Loved them for using under a wetsuit when scuba diving. Worn under shorts pre dive, when needed just slid the wetsuit over them and were very comfortable.I have had to buy a second set as all my dive buddies in Egypt wanted mine so I have given them away🤣

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym

I should have got XL because i got big beefy legs  but I  general I am satisfied.  Would buy another set different colours but larger size.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Delivery by Amazon was quick and efficient.  The compression shorts are great value for money. I’m 6’2” with a 36” waist so followed the size guide and bought size L. The fit is good. One minor observation is make sure your over shorts have a drawstring. My medium sized thighs (24”/61cm circ) play tug of war with the waist band and two thighs is no match for one waist. I can fit my iPhone 13 in the pocket with ease.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Super comfortable, work great for working out. I don’t recommend wearing these during heatwaves as they can get pretty sweaty in intense heat. Unlikely to happen to anyone else, when I ordered mine I got a three pack containing to mediums and a pair of xl. However the xl was still useable due to the stretch (i guess) just a tad loose.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: If you want casual shorts these are good,if you need it for athletic activities or for injury support, I don't think they are supportive enough. I am a medium I ordered a large based on the reviews and I probably should have gone with the medium.  They fit  snug on my legs but too loose around my waist. Still they are very comfortable and I will wear these for casual activities like cycling, rollerblading etc. And the phone pocket is a great feature. You need to wear these over underwear or under shorts because the material is thin enough that you are basically exposing yourself.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2022

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: I wear them as underwear or when I am training at home . Pockets are great addition but when you sit mobile slips out of your pocket. Really comfortable to wear and supports you when exercising.

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Comme beaucoup l'ont déjà dit : produit de qualité, tissu sublime, multiusages, quoi d'autre .🏆  J'avais usage de porter des sous-vêtements en coton parce que les tissus désuets m'irritaient la peau lors de mes séances . 👖 Je pensais que c'était trop serré mais j'estime que la pression me conviens parfaitement.Super-commode : Je pense qu'il provient d'un tissu de haute qualité et d'une extensibilité parfaite. ✔️ Ce tissu est une autre histoire, aussi bon qu'un coton par ailleurs mieux.👍 Je l'ai également trouvé idéal pour l'usage familier, et pour l'exercice , pour se reposer dans le jardin, déambuler aléatoirement et même de jouer assis sur la chaise.En particulier, il pourrait également être utilisé comme sous-vêtements pour dormir la nuit - mais oubliez-les si vous voulez dormir nu.Je suis entre L-XL et ces L me conviennent  - Je les préconise.Si mes observations vous ont été utiles et ont rendu votre choix positif ou négatif plus facile, merci de cliquez sur l'onglet UTILE ci-dessous. 🙏.🤝
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 October 2023

name: ZENGVEE 3 Pack Men's Compression Shorts Cool Dry Running Base Layer Shorts with Phone Pockets for Running,Training, Workout, Gym
reviews: Perfect for running long or short distances. Normally I have a waist band to carry my phone, keys and bank cards. These are perfect, the phone doesn't fall out and barely know it's there, same for keys. They don't fall down when running. They fit well and don't chafe,  great product to help carry your items.

name: Nike
reviews: Doesn’t state in the description they don’t have pockets. Not impressed at all.

name: Nike
reviews: Die Nike Herren Fußballshorts Park II sind ein absolutes Muss für jeden Fußballenthusiasten und Sportler. Diese Shorts kombinieren Komfort, Qualität und Leistung auf eine Weise, die beeindruckt.Die Pflege dieser Shorts ist denkbar einfach. Mit der Möglichkeit, sie einfach in der Maschine zu waschen, sparen Sie Zeit und Mühe. Der Pull-On-Verschluss sorgt für eine mühelose Anpassung und trägt zu einem nahtlosen Look bei.Das Material aus 100% Polyester zeugt von Nike's Hingabe zur Qualität. Die "Dry Park III" Technologie gewährleistet, dass Sie während des Spiels trocken und bequem bleiben. Feuchtigkeit wird effizient abgeleitet, um ein frisches Gefühl auf dem Spielfeld zu gewährleisten. Das leichtgewichtige Polyester sorgt für Bewegungsfreiheit und ermöglicht es Ihnen, Ihr Bestes zu geben, sei es beim Training oder im Wettkampf.Die Nike Herren Fußballshorts Park II sind nicht nur funktional, sondern auch stylish. Das Nike-Logo und das schlichte Design verleihen ihnen eine zeitlose Ästhetik, die zu jedem Trikot oder Sportoberteil passt.Mit dem Modellnummer BV6855 sind diese Shorts nicht nur ein Qualitätsprodukt von Nike, sondern auch eine klare Investition in Ihre sportliche Performance. Ob auf dem Fußballfeld, beim Training oder im Freizeitsport - diese Shorts bieten Komfort, Leistung und Stil in einem Paket.Insgesamt sind die Nike Herren Fußballshorts Park II eine hervorragende Wahl für Sportler, die nach Komfort und Funktionalität suchen. Die Kombination aus hochwertigem Material, innovativer Technologie und zeitlosem Design macht diese Shorts zu einem unverzichtbaren Bestandteil Ihrer Sportbekleidung.

name: Nike
reviews: Le short Nike que j'ai acheté est tout simplement exceptionnel. La qualité du tissu est remarquable, il est durable et résiste bien aux lavages répétés. De plus, la coupe est parfaitement ajustée, offrant un grand confort et une grande liberté de mouvement. J'apprécie également le style moderne et la variété de couleurs disponibles, ce qui me permet de choisir celui qui me convient le mieux. Bien que Nike puisse être un peu plus cher, la qualité et le confort en valent largement la peine. C'est un excellent choix pour tous ceux qui recherchent un short de sport de haute qualité.

name: Nike
reviews: Diese Sporthose ist einfach top! Ich habe sie für meine Trainingseinheiten im Fitnessstudio gekauft, und sie erfüllt alle meine Erwartungen.Zunächst einmal ist die Passform genau richtig. Sie sitzt bequem und bietet genug Bewegungsfreiheit, ohne zu locker zu sein. Der elastische Bund hält die Hose sicher an Ort und Stelle, egal welche Übungen ich mache.Das Material fühlt sich angenehm auf der Haut an und ist sehr atmungsaktiv. Auch nach schweißtreibenden Workouts bleibt die Hose angenehm trocken. Die Verarbeitungsqualität ist hervorragend, und die Nähte sind sauber und robust.Insgesamt kann ich diese Sporthose uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Sie ist bequem, funktionell und sieht auch noch gut aus. Top Hose!

name: Nike
reviews: ✅ Les plus :🟢 La matière utilisée est très souple, agréable au toucher et élastique.🟢 Il ne colle pas à la peau, ce qui est le rend agréable à porter lors de sa séance ce sport.🟢 Les tailles sont relativement respectées, bien qu’un peu plus longues qu’attendu.🟢 L’ajustement à la taille est très facile à réaliser grâce à la « corde » qu’il suffit de tirer et de nouer.🟢 Le lavage et le séchage se font rapidement et facilement. En effet, un lavage rapide est suffisant et la matière utilisée est impossible à tacher.🟢 Les finitions sont très bonnes ; aucun fil ne dépasse.❌ Les moins :🔴 Bien que la corde permette un réglage facile, il est important de noter que celle-ci peut quitter son logement en cas de lavage en machine, si aucun nœud n’est réalisé au préalable. La vigilance est donc de mise.➡️ Bilan :🔵 Après plusieurs semaines d’utilisation, je vous recommande ce produit qui sera compatible avec tous les sports et qui vous permettra de réaliser vos entrainements dans les meilleures conditions possibles. Son rapport qualité-prix est vraiment très bon.J'espère que mon avis vous aura aidé à réaliser votre choix.

Sowohl die Qualität als auch das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis, ist sehr gut!

name: Nike
reviews: Ich wollte euch gerne von meinen Erfahrungen mit den Nike Herren Fußballshorts berichten, die ich mir vor einiger Zeit gekauft habe. Ich muss sagen, ich bin absolut begeistert! Obwohl sie eigentlich für den Fußball gedacht sind, habe ich sie hauptsächlich für mein Training im Fitnessstudio verwendet.Was mir sofort aufgefallen ist, ist wie unglaublich bequem die Shorts sind. Das Material ist angenehm weich und elastisch, was eine optimale Bewegungsfreiheit ermöglicht. Egal ob ich Gewichte hebe, Cardio mache oder mich beim Boxen austobe, ich fühle mich in den Shorts jederzeit wohl und uneingeschränkt.Ein weiterer großer Pluspunkt ist die Atmungsaktivität der Shorts. Das Material ermöglicht eine gute Luftzirkulation und verhindert, dass ich übermäßig schwitze. Das ist besonders wichtig, wenn ich mich richtig ins Training reinhänge und ordentlich ins Schwitzen komme. Die Shorts halten mich angenehm kühl und trocken, sodass ich mich voll und ganz auf mein Workout konzentrieren kann.Die Passform der Shorts ist ebenfalls super. Der elastische Bund und der verstellbare Kordelzug sorgen dafür, dass die Shorts perfekt sitzen und nicht verrutschen. Das ist gerade bei Übungen wie Kniebeugen oder Burpees wichtig, bei denen man viel hin und her bewegt. Die Shorts bleiben an Ort und Stelle, ohne mich in meiner Bewegungsfreiheit einzuschränken.Ich hoffe, meine persönliche Erfahrung mit den Nike Herren Fußballshorts hilft euch bei eurer Entscheidung. Wenn ihr noch weitere Fragen habt, stehe ich gerne zur Verfügung!

name: Nike
reviews: Ich möchte euch meine Erfahrungen mit den Nike Herren Fußballshorts Park II mitteilen. Diese Shorts sind schlicht, bequem und erfüllen ihren Zweck hervorragend.Die Passform der Shorts ist großartig. Sie sitzen gut und bieten ausreichend Bewegungsfreiheit für verschiedene Aktivitäten. Der Stoff ist leicht und atmungsaktiv, was ein angenehmes Tragegefühl ermöglicht. Egal, ob ich mich im Fitnessstudio auspowere oder einfach nur zu Hause entspanne, diese Shorts fühlen sich immer gut an.Das Design der Nike Fußballshorts Park II ist schlicht und dennoch ansprechend. Das Nike-Logo verleiht ihnen einen Hauch von Sportlichkeit und Qualität. Sie sind in verschiedenen Farben erhältlich, um unterschiedlichen Geschmäckern gerecht zu werden.Ein Aspekt, den ich erwähnen möchte, ist jedoch das Fehlen von Taschen. Das kann enttäuschend sein, besonders wenn man gewohnt ist, Kleinigkeiten wie Schlüssel oder ein Handy in den Taschen zu verstauen. Es ist jedoch wichtig zu beachten, dass diese Shorts primär für sportliche Aktivitäten gedacht sind, bei denen das Tragen von zusätzlichen Gegenständen oft hinderlich sein kann.Trotzdem kann ich sagen, dass die Nike Herren Fußballshorts Park II eine gute Wahl sind, wenn ihr leichte und bequeme Shorts für verschiedene Anlässe sucht. Sie sind vielseitig einsetzbar und erfüllen ihren Zweck gut.Aufgrund des Fehlens von Taschen gebe ich diesen Shorts 4 von 5 Sternen. Sie bieten Tragekomfort und ein ansprechendes Design, aber eine kleine Tasche würde sie noch praktischer machen.

Weil es sonst fast nirgends steht und es mich tatsächlich selbst interessiert hätte, schreib ich es nun. Die Taschen sind sehr angenehm und gut an zu fassen. Für mein Geschmack leider etwas zu klein, aber in Ordnung!Fazit: mit einer Nummer größer bestellen absolute Empfehlung!

name: Champion Men's Long Mesh
reviews: Champion Men's Mesh Gym Shorts are a fantastic addition to any active individual's wardrobe. These shorts perfectly balance comfort and functionality, making them an essential choice for workouts and casual wear alike.The lightweight mesh material not only ensures optimal breathability but also allows for a full range of motion during exercise. Whether you're hitting the gym, going for a run, or playing sports, these shorts keep you cool and comfortable.The elastic waistband provides a secure fit without feeling restrictive, and the adjustable drawstring adds a customizable element to the fit. The minimalist design is versatile, making them ideal for pairing with various workout tops or casual shirts.What truly sets these shorts apart is Champion's commitment to quality. The durable stitching and attention to detail guarantee that they'll withstand regular use and countless washes while maintaining their shape and color.Whether you're a fitness enthusiast or simply enjoy comfortable clothing, Champion Men's Mesh Gym Shorts deliver on every front. Their combination of style, functionality, and durability makes them a reliable choice for all your athletic and leisure activities. Say goodbye to discomfort and hello to a new level of comfort and confidence with these remarkable shorts.

name: Champion Men's Long Mesh
reviews: Great deal, completely satisfied, and I will buy these again. I actually ordered three of these. I usually buy the Nike brand but decided to give these a try because they’re much cheaper. Definitely beats paying $30.00-$40.00 for the Nike branded shorts. They’re comfortable, light weight and don’t look bad either. Good for wearing around the house, running to the store, work, and anywhere else you’re comfortable wearing athletic shorts.The only negative that is a possibility is they will wear out faster than my Nike shorts, but I’m just assuming. Even if they do wear out faster I can still buy at least three pairs of these for the price of one pair of Nike shorts.Also I got fooled by the image. I thought one pair I ordered was white, but turned out to be grey. I made the mistake of not reading the item description, it does indeed say grey. Thought the order picker made a mistake, but it was my mistake.They seem to run a little bigger compared to the same size Nike shorts. I bought a XL assuming they’d be the same size, I think I could have ordered a large and they would fit perfect. Should have ordered according to their sizing chart.

reviews: Die UA HG Armour Gym Sport Running Shorts von Under Armour haben sich als hervorragende Ausrüstung für mein Training erwiesen. Das Material ist dehnbar und passt sich allen Bewegungen an, ohne einzuschränken, was für dynamische Workouts unerlässlich ist. Der hohe Polyesteranteil sorgt für eine schnelle Trocknung und die Elasthan-Beimischung für eine perfekte Passform.Das Design mit dem großflächigen Logo ist ein echter Hingucker und bleibt auch nach mehrmaligem Waschen unverändert. Die Qualität des Stoffes und der Verarbeitung sind genau das, was man von einer Marke wie Under Armour erwartet: langlebig und zuverlässig.Nicht nur im Fitnessstudio, auch im Freien bieten die Shorts hohen Tragekomfort und halten auch intensiven Trainingseinheiten stand. Die Größenauswahl und die Passform entsprechen den Angaben, was bei Online-Bestellungen ein großer Pluspunkt ist. Abschließend lässt sich sagen, dass diese Shorts eine klare Empfehlung für alle sind, die Wert auf Qualität, Komfort und Stil legen.

name: Under Armour Men's Armour HeatGear Compression Shorts
reviews: Die Under Armour Herren UA HG Armour Gym Sport Running Shorts verkörpern für mich die Qualität und Wertigkeit, die die Marke Under Armour auszeichnet. Der Preis für diese Shorts ist angemessen und spiegelt die gebotene Leistung und Verarbeitung wider.Der Stoff der Shorts fühlt sich angenehm auf der Haut an und gewährleistet während des Trainings ein bequemes Tragegefühl. Die Qualität der Shorts ist evident, sowohl in der Materialauswahl als auch in der Verarbeitung.Hervorzuheben ist die perfekte Passform der Shorts, die sich optimal an den Körper schmiegt und uneingeschränkte Bewegungsfreiheit ermöglicht. Diese Eigenschaft ist besonders relevant, wenn die Shorts während verschiedenster sportlicher Aktivitäten wie im Fitnessstudio oder beim Laufen getragen werden.Die Vielseitigkeit der Shorts ist ein weiteres Highlight. Sie sind gleichermaßen geeignet für sportliche Betätigungen, das Training im Gym oder das Laufen im Freien. Ihre Qualität und Bequemlichkeit machen sie zur optimalen Wahl für all jene, die nach funktionaler und angenehm zu tragender Sportbekleidung suchen.Zusammenfassend empfehle ich die Under Armour Herren UA HG Armour Gym Sport Running Shorts aufgrund ihrer Qualität, optimalen Passform und Vielseitigkeit. Sie stellen eine lohnenswerte Investition dar für alle, die Sportkleidung suchen, die sowohl Komfort als auch Qualität vereint.

name: Under Armour Men's Armour HeatGear Compression Shorts
reviews: Needed to replace my previous UA compression shorts that have lasted over 5 years.  These have a very good fit, they don't ride up and have excellent sweat wicking.  I use these for kickboxing/ju-jitus/running , the side-pocket for a phone seems a bit superfluous.  Usually I'm a size L, but if you have large legs go a size up to XL, the waistband has good elasticity, won't slip and doesn't 'pinch'.  Overall, 10/10 for quality, performance and value. Highly recommended.

name: Under Armour Men's Armour HeatGear Compression Shorts
reviews: First off, these are top notch, have great colors, and feel durable. I put a pool in my backyard and decided it was time to update my 15 year old Walmart swim trunks so I visited a few websites and decided I’d form brand loyalty with “Salt Life”. I knew I wanted the board shorts and didn’t need another set of trunks with a net inside (I decided on Columbia shorts with the net). I prefer board shorts and they are so much more comfortable however I don’t care for the lack of support and probability I’d be the guy from “Friends” in the coffee shop that Phoebe was dating. Boxers underneath are an option but they take forever to dry and will inevitably cause an apocalyptic rash. So, I set out to find an alternative and decided on these. Low and behold they work perfectly and I now have a pair of these for every set of board shorts. These do increase the time it takes to dry unfortunately, but they won’t wage war on everything sensitive and they dry faster than boxers.Update 9/17/2023: Just ordered and received a third pair of these. They are sure pricey but I love them still. Each pair is holding up great and still fit well.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 21 April 2023

name: Wrangler
reviews: I like these shorts, they are loose, but not baggy. I ordered a 36, and they fit me very well. Ample pockets for wallet, phone, keys and loose change. The colors I ordered were perfect, I ordered the grey/white camo pattern as well as the Camel, which is khaki. I did send one pair back to be replaced becasue the zipper stuck, I certainly don't think that's becasue of lack of quality, it some times happens, but these shorts are built very well but aren't too thick and heavy. I will definitely buy another pair as they represent solid value for the purchasing dollar.

name: Wrangler
reviews: This cargo shorts is the best one I bought so far compared to all other brands. It is lightweight and soft compared to other brands that feels heavy when worn. It is true to its size and love that sizes have odd number options 29, 31, 33 unlike other brands which only has even number sizes e.g. 32, 34, 36 etc. It fits exactly as I want it to be. The additional pockets are so great to have that you can use and forget carrying a small bag in some occasions. The delivery was swift and courier was courteous enough to let me know it's delivered. Overall I am satisfied and thank you seller for the best service! I recommend this to all cargo short fanatics out there!

reviews: I needed to replace a pair of shorts for manual work. The fabric is very strong for wear and tear. Pockets are useful for the odd tools and fasteners.

name: Wrangler
reviews: I've always had Wrangler products in the past (mostly jeans) but I've come across a few of their cargo shorts.  I wasn't sure what to expect with this pair of pants as I've had bad experiences in the past with older companies going "cheap" and sacrificing quality for the sake of better margins (i.e. Levi's).This pair of pants definitely exceeded my expectations in terms of quality, comfort and style!  It fit very snug and the premium twill is worth the extra $ and the pricing is still competitive enough to consider this a bargain.  I was expecting a bit more "padding" in terms of the material used as it is a bit thinner compared to previous pants I've worn from Wrangler.  It doesn't seem like it will wear out quickly so maybe the thinner material was done on purpose to help with comfort in the heat.  I've owned these for about 3 years now and they are still going strong!  Finally made the time to review these.  Will consider buying more of these in the future!

reviews: Really nice shorts,  Velcro pockets and lots of them.  The only thing keeping it from 5 stars are the cellphone pockets.  You might tightly squeeze in some of the newer phones without a protective case but, for sure, I can't get mine in and I just have a protective case that does not cover the screen.  Even if I could try to get it into the pocket with a lot of effort it would be a time consuming process to remove it.  Older phones (real old ones) might fit.  Mine is 3 years old and it doesn't fit!There are 3 horizontal "phone" pockets with velcro flap closures- phone won't fit in any of them.It needs one VERTICAL pocket big enough for phones.  Vertical would also match the contour of your leg.

name: Lee Men's Dungarees New Belted Wyoming Cargo Short
reviews: I get all husbands wardrobe from Amazon & this first pair of shorts I've ever ordered that was huge in size. Not sure how happen but we looked at size & it was 40 in waist. Always ordered 38's and all fit husband perfect. How we ended up with these big shorts we dont know. Husband didn't try on as soon as we got. We both purchased a new summer wardrobe. Which is lots of new shorts, shirts, tanks & blouses. Amazon I use alot for us & rarely we ever now come across not something that don't fit. Hung up & husband only picks shorts a couple times a week. Works long hours & 6 days a week. Time he decides to put these on, he asks me, what in world did I get. Really huge in size. More like a 44 because I say what about belt & use for home comfy. I came & looked at them. No way only word Huge! So I told him to late to return & the cost in shipping. Plus chances are not get size correct in this brand. So we donated to our charity
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 18 August 2018

name: Lee Men's Dungarees New Belted Wyoming Cargo Short
reviews: Muy buena calidad, muy bonito diseño, tela bastante resistente, perfecto todo, entrega rápida, solo la talla, viendo las reseñas, vi que todos recomendaban pedir una talla más grande y yo lo hice así y me quedó perfecto, claro en una talla más grande.

name: Lee Men's Dungarees New Belted Wyoming Cargo Short
reviews: Really comfortable shorts but it doesn't take much for them to start losing their coloring and fading.  And it's not a consistent color fade, you'll have darker areas and lighter areas across the shorts. I have these in 3 colors and the darker colors do it the most; I've yet to see it happen in the khaki color.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Edit 29th Apr 18. Worn about 20 times since purchase and now ripped at stitching at rear seam whilst squatting. This is not at the stretch panel, shame they didnt use a bit of the stretch panel at the rear seam.Over all still good shorts but just cant handle heavy squatting. I am tempted to try a larger size see if the extra room will perform better.Very strong shorts with stretch material in backside area which is good for squatting, as they don’t rip like most do under heavy load. They have a good rise as well which is rare in today’s climate of shorts hanging half way down your backside. However they are totally let down when it comes to leg room. I purchased a size up from what I needed as recommended in another review and they are barley loose on my thighs. After squatting in them I have been left with red marks and bruising where the material has been so tight around my thighs. I thought rugby shorts would be good due to the leg size of the players, clearly not in this case. If you have larger thighs (mine are only 29 inches, so I don’t consider them large at all) and plan on doing gym work I would avoid these. Such a shame as could have been perfect with 1-2 more inch of thigh room.

reviews: Produkt kam sowas von SOFORT, damit habe ich nicht gerechnet! Die shorts sind rugby-typisch relativ eng und robust - sollte auch am feld eine gute figur machen. Ohne die dehnbaren Stellen am Oberschenkel aussen und im Schritt wäre ein „normales“ Bewegen wohl nicht möglich - für rugby aber wunderbar. Die Shorts sind relativ kurz (wie beschrieben und wie gewollt), relativ eng und mit Größe Large (bei 183 cm Körpergröße und normalerweise Hosengröße je nach Schnitt 34 oder 36) noch gut passend, aber viel Platz ist dann nicht mehr. Qualität wie erwartet sehr gut!

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: I love these shorts. Although a rugby player, I actually bought them for the gym. Having quite big thighs and butt, I struggle with most training pants, particularly at the bottom of the squat. I have ripped several trousers this way and the result with some shorts is that they stick on the thighs and pull the waistband down, so I end up partially mooning the rest of the gym while in the squat rack!The added thick lycra/ stretch areas around the groin and sides of the thighs mean these babies stay right where you put the on and no risk of exploding out of them. Tough and durable as well and the material doesn't fade when washed. So the colour looks crisp still after several washes.

name: Nautica Men's Classic Fit Flat Front Stretch Solid Chino Deck Short
reviews: This review is for Nautica Men's Classic Fit Flat Front Stretch Solid Chino 8.5" Deck Shorts.  I have them in both Khaki and Blue Indigo.  The colors look better than what is show in the listings, especially the blue indigo.  The material is very nice and comfortable.  The slight stretch adds to the fit and comfort.  These are also true to size.  The length ends just at the top of my knee cap.  The front pockets aren't very deep or shallow.  I was a little concerned that my wallet or large phone would drop out of the front pockets, but I have not had any issues.  Overall, these shorts are excellent, and I am very happy with them.

name: Nautica Men's Classic Fit Flat Front Stretch Solid Chino Deck Short
reviews: During summer I live in these.  So far I have bought 4 of these shorts and all 4 are great.  The length is perfect, not too long and not too short, just above the knees.  The crotch area is very comfortable, when you sit your friends will not get crushed.  Pockets are nice and deep, I can fit my iPhone 13 Max comfortably and without having to constantly adjust and it doesn't leave a big imprint, even when i sit down the phone is not in the way.  I am 5'9" and 180 Lbs athletic build and waist 35 fits me very well.  The cloth and workmanship is also good.  My plan is to eventually buy all the colors.  So the fit, the style, the cloth, the tailoring all combine to give you a relaxed summery shorts.  if you are looking for skinny fit tight shorts then don't get these.  Hope that was helpful.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 21 July 2022

name: Volcom
reviews: Right off the bat, let's talk color. I was looking at the burnt sienna for a while but I was worried that they were going to be too orange and/or too bright. They aren't. The product photo is pretty close to what you get. In bright light like in the photo of me wearing them, they do appear lighter but it's not obnoxious.I would refer to these more as burgundy than orange but color perception can be variable across people.I am not the kind of person who wears bright colored shorts that stand out. My other shorts are tan, light grey, dark gray, khaki... These burnt sienna shorts are on the edge of my comfort zone but I really like them!As for the shorts themselves, I love them. I already have several other pairs of Volcom shorts. They are casual but look polished. The length falls at my knee (I'm 6 feet tall). They have a slightly slim cut so they aren't baggy. Deep front pockets. Normal back pockets, no button closure.(they are wrinkly on me because I put them on straight out of the bag)

name: Lee Mens 21861 Extreme Motion Swope Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: If you are like me, an ‘80’s baby who grew up in the ‘90’s and spent his entire 20’s in the 2000’s these shorts will remind you of those shorts back then but with a better fit. They aren’t baggy but they are loose enough that you don’t feel like you will hulk your way through the fabric. The waste has a slight stretch that gives you a perfect half size to full size of play which is perfect for me, a 40 year old man with three kids, who does not watch what he eats. Put these in your cart and wait until the price goes down because these and Levi’s jeans always go on sale at some point where you can spend almost half as much and sometimes less. I got them in black and they will match everything. I am 5’11” and 180lbs and a 33” waste is good for me. Lots of useable pockets and the front ones are nice and deep perfect for your cell phone and wallet. Even enough room for a phone and pocket knife in the same pocket. Would recommend.

name: Lee Mens 21861 Extreme Motion Swope Cargo Short Cargo Shorts
reviews: The comfort level of these shorts is outstanding. The fabric has just the right amount of stretch, allowing for unrestricted movement during any physical activity. Whether I'm hiking, cycling, or simply lounging around, the shorts never feel restrictive or uncomfortable. The waistband is adjustable and features a flex waist for a customizable fit, adding to the overall comfort factor.In terms of durability, the Lee Men's Extreme Motion Swope Cargo Shorts certainly impressed me. I have worn them on multiple occasions, and they have held up remarkably well. The construction feels solid, and the stitching is strong, ensuring that these shorts will withstand the test of time. Even after frequent use and washing, I have not noticed any signs of wear or tear.The cargo pockets are another notable feature of these shorts. They provide ample storage space for essentials like keys, a phone, or a small wallet. The pockets are deep enough to securely hold items, and the Velcro closures ensure that nothing falls out during physical activities or when you're on the move.The only reason I deducted one star from the rating is that, while the shorts are durable overall, the color tends to fade slightly after repeated washes. However, this is a minor drawback and doesn't significantly impact the functionality or overall appeal of the shorts.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 14 February 2018

The rest of the pockets are great to have if you are heading to the park or beach.

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: I first ordered size 36, the size I wear in my Carhartt shorts, but the size was much too larger. I returned them and ordered the shorts in a size 34, but these were too big. I returned them for a refund. I liked the features of the UnionBay brand, so I ordered them in a size 32, they fit perfect! Although, I was surprised that they seamed to be made of o heavier cloth material and the small pocket, on each leg, did not have a flap over the pocket. I used the small pocket for small items, like nail clippers, small Leatherman, etc.. The very first day I wore one of the pairs, I lost my favorite nail clippers. A real bummer. Lesson learned: Don't put anything anything in the small pockets because you have a very good chance of loosing whatever you put in them. Other than that, I love the quality of all the different pairs I ordered.

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: Great quality and a nice fit. This is my second pair of these shorts and I think that is the best recommendation you can give. These fit well and are nicely finished with velcro on the pockets, not annoying snaps. The pocket flaps are designed in such a way as to not fold over in the wash and stay that way for the life of the garment. Material weight is medium and just right for summer or warmer climates. A casual but good looking pair of shorts. I order these in the same size as my other pants and shorts.

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: These are the newer version of the cargos and they are quite a bit tighter through the waist, butt and quad.  A friend ripped the inseam out of his while trying to pick up something off the ground.  From his experience, I took it easy on any lifting and have to hike up the legs just to bend over or lift anything.Full disclosure: I have full-figured quads/butt from a lot of weight lifting, but the friend who tore his pants is a slim guy.

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: Hangs just above the knee. The sizing is on point, but generous. 11" inseam is great. Side pocket depth is good, flaps adequate. I like the velcro closures on the pocket flaps. I dont use the rear pockets. No current problem with my stitching, after 1 wash. Fabbed in Shri Lanka. Fabric is decent thickness and soft. Minimal number of belt loops. I like the color (Android), it looks like the pic. 1 point off for the zipper, which the up/down movement is not smooth, concern the this may limit the life of the shorts. Also the belt is a waste of material. Should can the belt and put that savings into a better, smoother operating zipper, then I'd give these shorts a 5! But from a price standpoint, I would recommend.

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: Material and stitching is rugged, (as I had expected).  I use for getting dirty doing yard work.  Long just as advertised in pictures, but longer than I like.  Great to have a belt but the D-ring style is somewhat frustrating. Belt is removable so I expect I will soon use a regular belt.  Great value!

name: UNIONBAY Men's Survivor Belted Cargo Short-Reg and Big & Tall Sizes
reviews: Pro's  They use Velcro instead of buttons on the pocket flaps, it makes it so much easier to open. Buttons make the flaps wrinkle when not buttoned up. Well stitched, The front pockets are deep, so things won't fall out, well worth the money to me. Con's would be that they are 11 inch inseam, and is over the top part of my knee cap. I prefer a 9 inch inseam. Last time I bought cargo shorts was 15 years ago, and the material is thinner then my old ones. The small front pocket on the left side, made for a key fob doesn't have a Velcro flap, and you could possibly lose your key fob if it were to fall out. The belt looks ok, but I use my own belt. I did like these so much, that I decided to buy more.

name: Liberty Imports Pack of 5 Men's Athletic Basketball Shorts Mesh Quick Dry Activewear with Pockets
reviews: These aren’t high quality athletic shorts by any means, they’re 1 layer of fabric that isn’t the softest or most breathable. But they’re still very comfortable and an exceptional value. We got these mostly for “days off” and relaxing at home and not to be too worried if the cats snag the fabric on them. A little disappointed with the print patterns on these shorts, I worry that it’ll crack or seriously degrade with frequent wear and washing. I’m 5’5, we got the large size and they’re a bit long on me, just below the knee so I tend to wear mine up a bit higher. My husband is 5’9 and the large fits him well and falls just above the knee. There is an adjustment band inside these in case you prefer to size up. Very convenient to have more pairs of this style of shorts in our wardrobe.

name: Liberty Imports Pack of 5 Men's Athletic Basketball Shorts Mesh Quick Dry Activewear with Pockets
reviews: For a shade under $35 (on sale), honestly I wasn't expecting much. With that said, I'm pleasantly surprised! I've tried a number of cheaper brand shorts from Amazon over the years, and these are the perfect balance of fit, price, and weight without being see through. Are they the quality of a pair of $50 shorts from Nike? Well, no, but you're getting 5 pair for less than one of those, and I'd say the quality is 85-90% of the way there.The main problem I tend to have with cheap shorts is the fit. More often than not, they end up being too tight in the groin area, which makes them sit awkwardly on your thighs/butt. Not these though, they hang just right, and look just how they should. Going to order another set just because of how pleased I am!If you're looking for quality cheap shorts, these are for you!

reviews: For $34 you get five pairs of shorts!  The quality is similar if not the same as name brand shorts. They are well made and sewn. I normally wear a 35 or 36 in jeans.  I'm 6'1" 190 lbs.  These shorts fit perfectly. They have a nice cord but I don't need it and I can walk with my phone in one pocket and keys in the other and the shorts stay up perfectly, yet they don't feel tight. They are really light but well-made and don't feel too thin. They are just right. The color selection is good and considering that one pair of shorts could easily cost you between $27 and $45 if not more, you can't beat this deal. I'm glad I was able to take advantage of it.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: I prefer a basic, no-frills, inexpensive workout short for my exercise activities (about 1-1.5 hours per day, 3-4 times per week). After years of buying Champion brand, I decided to give the Russell product a try based on positive reviews. I found these to be a good value. What I like most about them is the fit, which is a bit looser and longer than the Champion model.  At 5'8", 165 lbs with a 33 waist, medium is just perfect for me. The material is smooth and breathes well. The waist is snug enough for the shorts to stay put, but not too tight to be comfortable. I like the pockets, which I use to hold my little iPod shuffle during my workouts. Overall a solid product and sufficient for my purposes.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: (I did not receive any compensation, discount or free products for my review. I don't work for this company. This is just flat honesty.)  The first thing I can say is I am pleasantly surprised that shorts of this quality come at such a low price point. That is a big selling point here. I could buy Nike, but why when I can get the same thing for $11-$12 bucks? That seems like a waste of money. Mind you, I'm not a, "Keep up with the Jones' kind of guy.)  So, unless you just have to have a "brand," buy 3 or 4 pair of these instead.  **After having having several pair of these shorts for over a month I came back to edit my review from a 4 star rating to a 5. I suppose since I've already ordered several additional pair I really like them. I wear them around the house every day. They are extremely comfortable - not only for relaxing but for yard work, painting, etc. In fact, I like these shorts so much that I hate it when I don't have a pair clean, so like I said, "I ordered more!"  I live in central hell, where the summer climate is so hot that the last thing you want to do is work outside or in a hot garage. Yet, the mesh fabric accomplishes its job -matching the description. The mesh allows heat to escape and maintain a cool feeling without trapping in sweat. (Whomever created the fabric should be rich by now.) When beckoned I come in from the garage, sit down at the dinner table and the shorts are throughly dry.  *The shorts launder easily and hold up well in hot water and a hot dryer. No special steps required. I don't like athletic shorts that you can't just toss in the dryer. Some expensive shorts state, "Wash only. Hang to dry." That's too much work! Draw string is one piece with a knot below, so you don't have to worry about loosing the string in the washer and then trying to find it and put it back in. (I hate that.)  Exercising: I've worked out for 35 years, and I can tell you these are some of the coolest and most comfortable shorts I've ever worn. The pockets are the perfect depth. There is plenty of room to fit my keys and iphone 6-plus. Unlike some shorts, whatever is in my pocket's stays there. It does not fall out. (The manufacturer gets some points there.) I don't have to worry about loosing my keys, an adventure I'd rather skip. (Of course, be logical.) I wouldn't recommend engaging in heavy athletic activities with expensive items in your pocket, yet I can wear the shorts to make a quick trip to the store without my phone falling out.  Importantly, there is plenty of room in the circumference of the legs to allow for men with very muscular thighs. The fabric stretches a bit, but will not remain stretched out. If you have huge thighs you might consider ordering a size larger than normal unless you fancy very tight shorts? I've never had that issue. There is ample room in the crotch for any man; however, be aware that you will not get any athletic support from the shorts. So, depending you your preference and need you may wish to wear protection underneath.  Lastly, the shorts are a bit longer than I expected. The waist to knee measures 19" and the crotch to bottom of shorts is 13". I am 6'3", and the bottom meets the top of my knee.  That is a thorough review of the shorts. I hope it helps you make an educated decision.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 12 May 2016

name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: I don't usually review items promptly but the customer service is something to talk about.  I ordered a size L and they sent me an M.  The paper tag said L but the actual tag on the shorts said M so the mix-up was understandable.  I ordered a size L a second time so they would arrive on time for my boyfriend's birthday and emailed amazon about returning the size M.  I heard back right away from the seller and was told that my money will be refunded and that I do not have to go through the hassle of returning the shorts.The new shorts that were correctly labeled size L on both tags came in today and they are great.  The Texas Orange is a beautiful burnt copper color and I couldn't be happier about it.  The shorts themselves are long which is great because my boyfriend is 6ft 4 and has trouble with basketball shorts being too short sometimes, but these will look great on him.  The pockets are a big plus because he likes to have a place to put his keys and phone when he goes out.  The elastic on the shorts is really strong but very stretchy meaning that they will be comfortable but won't fall down.  What I loved the most about the shorts is how thin the material is.  My boyfriend gets very sweaty and always complains about shorts being 'too hot' but these are so airy and light that I think he will love them.  I will be ordering in more colors after I get his take on these shorts.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 27 September 2014

name: Russell Athletic Men's Mesh Short with Pockets
reviews: These shorts were definitely worth the buy. A lot better than I had expected, and here's why:-the shorts a very comfy. That may be due to the mesh being a little bit bigger in perforations as compared to other mesh shorts. The perforations are big enough to provide more than enough breathing room and ventilation, but not so big that the shorts are super-see through.-the material not only feels good but looks good. I ordered the green colorway and it looks really nice. I'm even planning on making another order, that is if I decide whether or not these are better quality than Champion branded shorts.-it has pockets which is a must for me when it comes to shorts I plan to use on a consistent basis to be able to hold my keys and wallet.-the drawstring is also strong enough so that if I were to have my phone, keys and wallet in my pockets, the shorts won't drop.All in all, these shorts are really nice, both for home use and outdoor use for walking and sports alike.If I were able to help you make a purchase, or help you prevent from making one you'd regret. Then all I ask is you thumbs up my review saying it was helpful, because knowing I helped someone out means a lot.

I wear medium size shorts but with Russsel Athletics the waistbands have so much stretch and I don't need exessive baggy leg holes I always buy a size small and still get the same perfect fit as a medium and a 7" inseam which is still perfect with my 6'2" height. name: Under Armour UA Tech Short, Mens, Bottoms, Shorts, 10 in
reviews: As an avid golfer, I recently added the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Shorts to my golfing gear collection, and they have exceeded my expectations in every way!First and foremost, the comfort level of these shorts is unmatched. The fabric is incredibly soft and lightweight, providing a perfect balance of flexibility and breathability during those hot summer rounds on the golf course. I no longer feel restricted in my movements, allowing me to focus solely on my swing and performance.The moisture-wicking technology is a game-changer! Even during the hottest and most intense rounds, these shorts keep me dry and cool, eliminating any discomfort caused by sweat. It's impressive how quickly they dry, ensuring I stay comfortable throughout the game.The fit is spot on! With the elastic waistband and adjustable drawstring, I can easily customize the fit to my liking, ensuring a snug and comfortable feel without worrying about them slipping during my swings.Moreover, the design of these shorts is both sleek and sporty, making me look and feel like a professional golfer on the course. The variety of colors available is a nice touch, allowing me to mix and match with my golf shirts.Durability is another standout feature of the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Shorts. After numerous washes and rounds of golf, they still look and feel brand new, with no signs of wear and tear.Whether it's a casual weekend round with friends or a competitive tournament, these shorts have become my go-to choice. I even wear them for other outdoor activities and everyday wear because of their versatile and comfortable nature.In conclusion, the Under Armour Men's Tech Golf Shorts have truly elevated my golfing experience. The combination of comfort, performance, and durability is unparalleled, making them an essential part of my golfing gear. If you're a golfer looking for high-quality shorts that excel in every aspect, don't hesitate to grab a pair of these fantastic shorts—you won't be disappointed! ⛳️🏌️‍♂️
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 1 August 2023

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: I've been buying Large size shorts and other pants for 30 years. The unstretched dimensions are ok, but the elastic stretches far too easily and almost doubles in size! I'm not that kind of build, so while they seem great quality for the price, you need to be quite large for these shorts not to slip down...as for using the pockets...this could be quite embarrassing with a mobile phone and or wallet! The drawstring is interesting - it is a loop, and may need to be cut to be able to be tied in a bow. I'd probably be ok with the next size down but don't get the option to exchange online so I returned these shorts for a refund.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: These shorts have convinced me not to buy any more items from an American dealer. I bought a large size, which I am normally in Australia and I am practically swimming in these shorts. The length comes WELL below the knee and I look like such a geek in them.I suspect I should have gone a small size. Which to me is absurd. American men must be giants.The fabric is alright; not great. The pockets are not sewn into place and kinda flop around which is annoying.I think I'm going to use them as pyjama pants tbh.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: Massively over sized. Return policy for international means I'd have to pay more to have it returned that it cost me to buy. So I'm stuck with clown shorts.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: This size is substantially larger than Australian sizes. I would suggest 5xl USA size is a 2 or 3 XL Australian

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: These cotton shorts are super light and breathable so they're perfect to sleep in or wear around the house.  As all the reviews say they run bigger than the sizing chart would suggest. By the chart I should be L but I got M and it was the perfect size, so go a size down- you'll feel good about yourself too in the illusion that you've lost weight.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: These shorts are comfortable. Better still, they're sized correctly. I've had problems with discounted clothing because it was sized according to Asian standards.The only improvement I could suggest is that there were more colours to choose from.I use these shorts for pajama bottoms in the summer months. Because they have pockets, I can wear them as shorts during the day. So I get a lot of use out of them.

name: Russell Athletic Men's Cotton Baseline Short with Pockets
reviews: These shorts are great for lounging around the house, and for wearing to bed, especially if you don't like sleeping in long sweats/pajamas.I don't recommend these for the gym or really any outdoor activity due to the style and thin-fabric: They're really just too casual of a style for more than lounging. That's just my opinion, of course, so if you're the type of dude to wear old, ratty, grey sweats, or worn-out t-shirts with the sleeves personally cut-off, out in public -by all means, knock yourself out!I've had several pairs of these over the last decade, and they're my go-to sleep-shorts. All of my original purchases were at Sports Authority, then 2 from Amazon within the last year.Although they are pretty lightweight and soft, the shorts are comparatively quite durable, as none of mine have ever worn through or come apart -- I just seem to lose a pair every couple of years, on a trip or at a hotel stay, then re-purchase.  The current shorts' material is approximately the same as my originals, but the stitching around the waistband is much less detailed, and frankly looks a bit sloppy.  The older shorts had very detailed, sturdy, and useful stitching around the waist and drawstring-area -I've attached some pics for comparison.  My recent purchase had long strands of excess thread dangling from some of the stitching.  I had to trim all of this off, in lieu of better quality control at the factory or by the distributor.The inner tag is still annoyingly sewn into the vertical seam right at the top of your tailbone (butt-crack, to be crass), so I just carefully cut it out before the first laundering.I'm not a fan of logos -- but for information's sake, the logo used to be embroidered onto the leg and now it's simply silkscreened-on.The fit is "as-expected".I'm not super-happy with the waistband change or the loose thread everywhere, but I got my recent pair for half-off during prime-day, so -Score!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 September 2023

name: CARHARTT Men's Force Relaxed Fit Ripstop Cargo Work Short
reviews: These are VERY similar to ripstop BDU shorts made by Propper, Rothco or Tru-Spec but cost twice as much. There is no flexibility or adjustability in the waistband and they aren't as reinforced as the mil-spec cargo shorts. One trip through the washer and dryer and they fit like grape smugglers, so order a size up. Wash on cold, because they fade.The deal breaker for me, is that I go commando in the summer. The actual BDU shorts are button-fly, whereas these have a brutal tackle-snagging zipper.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Wenn erst einmal die bei einer Windows-Installation obligatorischen Updates durchgelaufen sind (bei mir ca. 3 Std mit mehreren Neustarts), dann läuft der kleine Notebook ganz ordentlich.Ich habe eine Mikro-SD-Karte eingelegt und speichere wegen des kleinen Laufwerks C: die von mir installierten Programme auf dieser Karte. Auch die Thunderbird-Profile liegen dort, die Platte C: würde sonst durch die E-Mails mehrerer Accounts unnötig gefüllt.Ich nutze Firefox, Thunderbird, Teamviewer und LibreOffice. Lediglich das Laden von Libreoffice dauert etwas, ist aber noch akzeptabel. Wahrscheinlich wäre eine schnellere Mikro-SD-Karte hier hilfreich gewesen.Ansonsten habe ich keine Schwächen gefunden. Windows startet normal schnell. Natürlich kann man von einem Celeron und 4 GB RAM keine Wunder erwarten. Rechenintensive oder speicherintensive Programme oder mehrere Programme gleichzeitig sind eine weniger gute Idee, ebenso Spiele.Der Schwerpunkt bei diesem Gerät liegt eben bei Größe, Gewicht und Akkulaufzeit. Es ist ideal, wenn man unterwegs einen kleinen, unauffälligen Notebook dabeihaben möchte.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Perfekt für unterwegs, Urlaub oder so. Nimmt wenig Platz weg. Trotzdem schnell und alle wichtigen Anschlüsse!

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Meine Jungs nutzen das wirklich kleine Laptop regelmäßig unterwegs im Auto, um halbwegs vernünftig Texte tippen zu können. Man kann auch wunderbar einen Film nebenbei gucken oder im Internet surfen. Das Laptop ist sehr kompakt und definitiv handlich. Das Gehäuse ist ausreichend fest und für den mobilen Einsatz wirklich nicht schlecht. Der Prozessor und der Speicher sind etwas schwach dimensioniert - das weiß man aber vorher. Echte Leistungswunder darf man nicht erwarten - auch die Bildschirmauflösung ist nicht so wahnsinnig hoch. Die normalen Windows-Anwendungen laufen aber hinreichend gut. Der Sound ist super - das Mikrofon ist auch vernünftig - so wie man das bei HP eigentlich immer erwarten kann.Für einen festen Arbeitsplatz wäre es für uns nicht geeignet - für den mobilen Einsatz (Schultasche, zwischen den Autositzen eingeklemmt, für den Urlaub im Hotel ohne Safe, ...) ist es als zusätzliches Gerät anständig und bezahlbar. Im Falle eines Verlustes ist der Schaden begrenzt, falls die Schultasche doch einmal eine unvorhergesehene Flugbewegung vollzieht. Ein Sim-Slot wäre noch praktischer. Gut wäre es auch, wenn sich das Gerät über den USB-Port laden ließe - ein Drama ist es aber nicht - der Akku hält auch ein ganzes Weilchen. Die Ladestecker anderer HP-Netzteile passen - das ist sehr angenehm.Für den richtigen Zweck ist es ein echt brauchbares und bezahlbares Gerät. Sehr leistungsstarke Laptop in dieser Baugröße kosten erheblich mehr.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ich halte mich kurz, die Bauqualität ist gut aber die Performance reicht nicht fürs Streaming. Fast jede Anwendung von YouTube schauen bis zu einem Discord Anruf überfordern dieses sonst großartige kleine Laptop.Zur Info, ich nutze das Model mit einem Intel N 4120 / 4GB RAM.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Der Rechner wurde schnell und ordentlich verpackt geschickt. Nach dem Auspacken das große Aha.... Die Verarbeitung ist absolut prima. Der Laptop scheint sehr stabil und die Tastatur ist einwandfrei und keineswegs labberig. Das Einrichten ging dann quasi wie von alleine und ist selbsterklärend. Anschließend wurden die Windows Updates heruntergeladen und installiert. Office 365 war auch als Gimmick mit an Bord, Herz, was willst du noch mehr? Der Bildschirm ist mit einer klaren Anzeige als einwandfrei zu bewerten. Der Rechner ist ausreichend schnell für Office-Anwendungen und zum Surfen im Internet, Streaming funktioniert ebenso einwandfrei. Die Akkuleistung geht auch absolut in Ordnung.Fazit: Ein kleiner schicker Reisebegleiter, der mehr Qualitäten hat, als der Preis vermuten ließe... Wer hierin dann aber den großen Bildbearbeiter sucht, muss in einer ganz anderen Preisklasse suchen, dafür ist das Netbook definitiv nicht gebaut....Die negativen Bewertungen hier kann ich absolut nicht nachvollziehen, wer höhere Ansprüche stellt, muss auch tiefer ins Portemonnaie greifen, ich bin angenehm überrascht und sehr zufrieden.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ich habe mir das Gerät für gekauft um ab und an an ihm zu arbeiten,Streamen von Filmen,Musik über Lautsprecher hören und für sonstige kleinere Aufgaben.Fangen wir mit dem positiven an.Das Notebook schaut wirklich klasse und hochwertig aus.Alles ist sauber verarbeitet und das Material macht einen hochwertigen und robusten Eindruck.Die erste Inbetriebnahme ging recht schnell und das Gerät war schnell einsatzbereit.Die Grafik ist gut .Das Notebook funktioniert erstmal gut bis man zb mehrere Anwendungen offen hat.Webseite offen, email schreiben und nebenbei Musik hören ?Absolut Grenzwertig!Das Notebook wird dann so langsam,dass man sich nebenbei mal schnell noch essen kochen kann,Spaziergang im Wald und wenn man nicht ganz so weit weg will wäre auch noch ein Urlaub drin.Mit viel Glück sind nach dem Urlaub die Anwendungen dann auch mal geöffnet.Nein,das ist natürlich übertrieben, aber das Notebook ist wirklich sehr langsam aufgrund seiner Komponenten.Anwendung für Anwendung ja,mehrere Anwendungen gleichzeitig nur mit Geduld und dann schmiert auch gerne mal was ab.Es kommt jedoch auch einfach auf die Anwendung an.Spiele spielen ?Nein!Mit Windows ist das Niotebook eine absolute Zumutung ,wenn man mehrere Sachen gleichzeitig macht .Die eingebauten Lautsprecher sind natürlich auch nicht das gelbe vom Ei,aber das ist auch bei teureren Geräten das gleiche .Hörgenuss lediglich mit Kopfhörern oder externen Lautsprechern.Das Touchpad reagiert gut und auch die Tastatur ist gut.Sie reagiert prompt und es lässt sich angenehm schreiben.Für die Schule zb ein gutes Produkt ,auch aufgrund der geringen Größe ,auch für E-Mails  die während der Zugfahrt mal schnell noch geschrieben werden wollen oder um mal schnell im Internet was nach zu schauen .Man bekommt hier klein schlechtes Produkt und für den Preis von 199 Euro aktuell kann man nicht mehr erwarten aber man sollte sich genau überlegen was man mit einem Notebbok so alles vor hat aber bd ggfls doch lieber ein teureres Gerät kaufen .

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Hab mir keine großen Hoffnungen gemacht als ich den Laptop bestellt habe. Aber ich muss sagen für die private Nutzung übertrifft der Laptop alle Erwartungen

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Zum Angebotspreis 199€ ein richtig schöner Rechner. Klein, leicht, handlich, performant.Die Windows 11s Installation habe ich gar nicht erst ausprobiert. Wenn ich schon ins Netzwerk gezwungen werden soll und einen Online Account erstellen soll reicht es mir schon. Ich lasse mich von M$ nicht gängeln und der S Modus ist eh indiskutabel. Office 365 will ich auch nicht: Meine Office Dokumente gehen nur mich etwas an.Mit Linux Mint 21.2 Mate Edition (Kernel 5.15) läuft alles out of the Box und sehr zügig.Das Bios ist etwas ungewöhnlich aufzurufen: Nach Einschalttaste sofort ESC drücken, dann erscheint ein Auswahlmenue. F10 führt dann weiter ins Bios. Die Fxx Tasten direkt drücken (ohne Fn oder ALT etc.) Die Tastaturbeschriftung ist da irreführend. Die Fxx Tastenbeschriftung läßt sich für ältere Semester nur mit Lupe entziffern.Im Bios läßt sich Secure Boot abschalten, sogar der Legacy Modus läßt sich auswählen. Booten von USBgeht problemlos, der Linux Installation steht nichts mehr im Wege.Allein die fehlende Ethernet Schnittstelle schmerzt ewas. Aber dafür gibt es ja für den USB-C Anschluß passende Adapter. Insgesamt hardwaremäßig ein sehr empfehlenswertes kleines Notebook. Schön wäre noch, wenn man es auch ohne Betriebssystem (etwas billiger ;-) ) bekäme.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Mir gefällt der kleine Laptop sehr gut.Er tut was er soll. Ist sehr leicht und überall einfach mitzunehmen. Fast leichter als ein Buch. Ich bin sehr zufrieden

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Meine Frau suchte ein Möglichst kleines Gerät, mir dem die üblichen Officeanwendungen laufen und ein bischen Social Media genutzt wird. Sie ist voll zufrieden.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Habe mir ein anderes Betriebssystem installiert Linux mint. Jetzt ist es eine kleine Rennmaschine super

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: In dieser Preisklasse darf man keine großen Luftsprünge erwarten. Aber: Verarbeitung ist in Ordnung, Performance ist in Ordnung. Verwendet wird er bei mir ausschließlich für Netflix, Spotify und gelegentlich Youtube, also STREAM... Dafür macht er seine Sache wirklich gut. Mir persönlich macht es auch nichts aus, dass beispielsweise das Konfigurationsmenü zwei Sekunden lädt, von regelrechten "Hängern" kann man hier nicht sprechen. Weiterhin ist für mich der Windows 11-S-Modus ausreichend, da sämtliche Googleservices, wie Mail oder Drive sowieso über den Browser erreichbar sind, da benötigt man keine entsprechende App aus dem Microsoftstore. Alles in allem bekommt man für 199 Euro ein ordentliches Notebook, wenn man seine Ansprüche anpasst.Zusatz nach ca. zwei Monaten:Nach dem Wechsel auf Linux Ubuntu wirkt der Rechner wie ausgewechselt. Jetzt merkt man erst, wie ressourcenfressend die Windowsinstallation - zumal im 11s-Modus - überhaupt ist. Er läuft viel flüssiger und kann mehrere Programme gleichzeitig stemmen. Unter Windows war Spotify zwar möglich, aber surfen und Spotify hingegen brachte die CPU an  ihre Grenzen. Da Ubuntu kostenlos ist, sollte man diese Möglichkeit unbedingt nutzen.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Wo soll man da anfangen. Win11s kann auf Home gewechselt werden. Zum surfen und stream ist das Ding ok, also wie ein Tablett ,Office geht auch noch flüssig aber das war es dann auch schon.  Grafik ist zum spielen überhaupt nicht  geeignet da funktionieren fast keine Spiele drauf,  wollte den traktor s3 damit betreiben aber es funktioniert sehr schlecht bis garnicht.  Innen leben ist ein soc also alles fix gelötet somit nicht erweiterbar außer der 64 gig Speicher durch eine sd karte oder usb Festplatte . Der Prozessor verträgt 8gig ram sind aber nur 4 gig drauf und so bleibt es  auch weil nicht erweiterbare Komponenten.  Irgendwie darf man da a e nicht viel  erwarten von hp,  weil um das geld bekommt man einen rasberry pi mit Monitor und Tastatur von denen.  Hab das Ding um 200€ bekommen +Office 360 1 Jahr Abo somit ok von der Preis-Leistung aber mehr  ist das Ding  echt nicht wert. Wer einen Laptop braucht für mehr als streaming und Office...Finger  weg von dem Gerät. Prinzipiell HP ist nicht empfehlenswert egal welche Preisklasse hab nur enttäuschende erfahrungen mit HP in den letzten jahren gemacht. 2 Sterne weil billig und funktioniert besser als mein altes Samsung Tablett.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ich habe mir das Gerät als Alternative zu einem Tablett gekauft. Es deckt genau das ab was ich möchte. Ein netter Begleiter für unterwegs. Es ist definitiv kein Arbeitslaptop, der alle möglichen Programme verträgt. Das Windows 11 war mehr als lästig und wurde durch Linux ersetzt.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Better than I expected considering that it is a refurbished computer.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ja, der Rechner ist günstig, aber man merkt es auch. Bis der Rechner hochfährt und man einen Browser geöffnet hat, kann man sich locker eine Tasse Kaffee machen. Ich brauche den Rechner nur als Zweit Rechner, um simple Anwendungen drauf laufen zu lassen und mir keine Malware einzufangen. Als Hauptrechner ist er aber völlig unbrauchbar, es dauert einfach alles zu lange.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Sehr guter Laptop, für mich ausreichend zum Surfen, Shoppen 1A +++

reviews: Gefällt mir sehr gut! Die Programmsperre habe ich nicht lustig gefunden. Solange die drauf war hat er sich selbst immer wieder aufgehängt. Ohne meinen Mann wäre ich da nie drauf gekommen, wie man das wieder bekommt und normale Programme runterladen kannst.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Immer mal wieder schließt der Laptop selbständig geöffnete Seiten, mit denen gerade gearbeitet wird.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Danke immer wieder.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ich habe mir den Stream angeschafft, weil ich das teure MB Air M2 nicht unbedingt mit zum Strand nehmen wollte. Die Verarbeitung ist wertig, Akkulaufzeit völlig in Ordnung und das System läuft rund. Ich habe Win 11 installiert und sämtliche Bloatware entfernt. Ich nutze den Laptop zum Surfen mit Chrome, und dafür reicht es. Tastatur ist super, Touchpad ist noch in Ordnung. Der Bildschirm ist nicht wirklich hell und aus manchen Winkeln schlecht zu erkennen, zum in der Hängematte liegen und entspannt surfen reicht es aber allemal.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ich muß mich mit zu vielen Macken herumärgern! Das Einrichten dauerte 6 Stunden, der Media Player hat Störgeräusche,  egal welche Titel man spielt und der Microsoft Store verhindert das Downloaden von Anti-Virus.Software. Außerdem ist er mir zu langsam und mit mehreren geöffneten Fenstern überfordert.Naja- für 200,- kann man wohl nicht mehr verlangen!Das Gute ist, daß er klein und leicht ist (gut für unterwegs) und hübsch aussieht (weiß aussen, innen silberfarben).

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Für unterwegs und für Schreibarbeiten habe ich den HP Stream gekauft und bin bis jetzt sehr zufrieden. Da ich damit hauptsächlich Texte schreibe, ist die Leistung optimal. Der Akku hält sehr lange. 8 Stunden locker. Für mich ein optimales Notebook zum Arbeiten unterwegs,handlich, leicht und eine lange Akkulaufzeit.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Alles O.K.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Wir haben den Laptop gekauft für Powerpointpräsentationen für unterwegs. Er ist sehr leicht und damit gut zu transportieren und das war uns wichtig, er hat alle notwendigen Anschlüsse / Ausgänge für Beamer usw. und ist damit schnell an die notwendigen Geräte anschließbar. Für dauerhaftes arbeiten mit diesem Laptop ist er nicht zu empfehlen. Sehr langsam, Speicher zu klein. Bei mehr als drei offenen Anwendungen bekommt man leicht die "Krise" betreffs der Geschwindigkeit.

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Ich suchte ein kleines Netbook für den privaten Gebrauch,mal ein Brief schreiben, mal ein Film gucken oder oder oderDieses HP Netbook war im Angebot und ich bestellte es, am Anfang machte es auch einen guten Eindruck.Es wurde kaum benutzt und wenn man es jetzt hochfährt dauert es ewig,der Bildschirm flackert,bis sich Seiten öffnen dauert es.Ich bin nicht so zufrieden

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Für unterwegs genau das richtige. Der Akku hält bei normaler Nutzung 3-4 Stunden. Es ist ausreichend schnell und für Texte/Youtube etc sehr gut geeignet

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Der LapTop ist klasse, wenn man das richtige Betriebssystem (Linux) verwendet. Denn, eines ist klar, mit Win11 läuft es nicht! Der Hersteller HP, den ich sonst sehr schätze, wird hier fast alle Geräte zurückbekommen, da Win11 viel mehr Power etc. braucht, mit Linux läuft es wie geschmiert und so wollte ich es auch haben. Für Anfänger ungeeignet, daher auch nur 4 Sterne

name: HP Stream Laptop | 11.6 Inch HD Display | Intel Celeron N4120 | 4GB DDR4 RAM | 64GB eMMC | Intel Graphics | Windows 11 S-Mode | QWERTZ Keyboard | White | Includes Microsoft Office 365 Single
reviews: Nach ein paar Tagen der Benutzung, kann ich als "Laie" damit gut umgehen. Entspricht voll meinen Vorstellungen. Angenehm überrascht war ich über die Größe der Tasten und wie diese reagieren. Viel besser wie bei meinem ACER Notebook. Optisch sieht dieses Gerät ansprechend aus, ist natürlich Geschmacksache.Wenn man "Pingelig" wäre, würde das schwarze Kabel stören. Weißes Kabel würde ich schöner finden.Windows 8.1 habe ich besser als Windows 11 empfunden, hat aber nichts mit dem Gerät zu tun. Klare Kaufempfehlung für einfache arbeiten.
